Value.label: Remember device status before the power failure
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react in the event of power supply failure

Item.label: Device remains switched of
Device restores the state from before the power failure

Value.label: Input 1 - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose mode of 1st input

Item.label: Analog input without internal pull-up (Sensor Multilevel)
Analog input with internal pull-up (Sensor Multilevel)
Momentary switch (Central Scene)
Toggle switch: switch state on every input change (Central Scene)
Toggle switch: contact closed – ON, contact opened – OFF (Central Scene)

Value.label: Input 2 - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose mode of 2nd input

Item.label: Analog input without internal pull-up (Sensor Multilevel)
Analog input with internal pull-up (Sensor Multilevel)
Momentary switch (Central Scene)
Toggle switch: switch state on every input change (Central Scene)
Toggle switch: contact closed – ON, contact opened – OFF (Central Scene)

Value.label: Input 3 - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose mode of 3rd input

Item.label: Analog input without internal pull-up (Sensor Multilevel)
Analog input with internal pull-up (Sensor Multilevel)
Momentary switch (Central Scene)
Toggle switch: switch state on every input change (Central Scene)
Toggle switch: contact closed – ON, contact opened – OFF (Central Scene)

Value.label: Input 4 - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose mode of 4th input

Item.label: Analog input without internal pull-up (Sensor Multilevel)
Analog input with internal pull-up (Sensor Multilevel)
Momentary switch (Central Scene)
Toggle switch: switch state on every input change (Central Scene)
Toggle switch: contact closed – ON, contact opened – OFF (Central Scene)

Value.label: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
Value.Help:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B [MSB] - Notification Type 2B - Notification Status 3B - Event/State Parameters 4B [LSB]

Value.label: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot
Value.Help:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B [MSB] - Notification Type 2B - Notification Status 3B - Event/State Parameters 4B [LSB]

Value.label: Alarm configuration - 3rd slot
Value.Help:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B [MSB] - Notification Type 2B - Notification Status 3B - Event/State Parameters 4B [LSB]

Value.label: Alarm configuration - 4th slot
Value.Help:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B [MSB] - Notification Type 2B - Notification Status 3B - Event/State Parameters 4B [LSB]

Value.label: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
Value.Help:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B [MSB] - Notification Type 2B - Notification Status 3B - Event/State Parameters 4B [LSB]

Value.label: Alarm configuration – duration
Value.Help:
This parameter defines duration of alarm sequence. When time set in this parameter elapses, alarm is cancelled, LED frame and relay restore normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm.
0 – infinite 1-32400 (1s-9h, 1s step) – duration
Default value: 600 (10min)

Value.label: First button – scenes sent
Value.Help:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
1 - Key pressed 1 time 2 - Key pressed 2 times 4 - Key pressed 3 times 8 - Key hold down and key released
Default value: 0 (no scenes)

Value.label: Second button – scenes sent
Value.Help:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
1 - Key pressed 1 time 2 - Key pressed 2 times 4 - Key pressed 3 times 8 - Key hold down and key released
Default value: 0 (no scenes)

Value.label: Third button – scenes sent
Value.Help:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
1 - Key pressed 1 time 2 - Key pressed 2 times 4 - Key pressed 3 times 8 - Key hold down and key released
Default value: 0 (no scenes)

Value.label: Fourth button – scenes sent
Value.Help:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
1 - Key pressed 1 time 2 - Key pressed 2 times 4 - Key pressed 3 times 8 - Key hold down and key released
Default value: 0 (no scenes)

Value.label: Power reports – include self-consumption
Value.Help: This parameter determines whether the power measurements should include power consumed by the device itself.

Item.label: self-consumption not included
self-consumption included

Value.label: Power reports – on change
Value.Help:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that results in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.
0 - reporting on change disabled 1-500 (1-500%, 1% step) – minimal change
Default value: 15 (15%)

Value.label: Power reports - periodic
Value.Help:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 61).
0 – periodic reports disabled 30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval
Default value: 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Analog inputs reports and output change on input change
Value.Help: This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) of analog input voltage that results in sending new report and change in the output value. Parameter is relevant only for analog inputs (parameter 20, 21, 22 or 23 set to 0 or 1)

Value.label: Analog inputs reports - periodic
Value.Help: This parameter defines reporting period of analog inputs value.

Value.label: Energy reports – on change
Value.Help:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that results in sending new report.
0 - reporting on change disabled 1-500 (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change
Default value: 10 (0.1kWh)

Value.label: Energy reports - periodic
Value.Help:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 65).
0 – periodic reports disabled 30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval
Default value: 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Inputs - LED colour control mode
Value.Help: This parameter determines how connected switches control LED strips.

Item.label: RGBW MODE
HSB and White mode

Value.label: Local control - transition time
Value.Help: This parameter determines time of smooth transition between 0% and 100% when controlling with connected switches.

Value.label: Remote control - transition time
Value.Help: This parameter determines time of smooth transition between 0% and 100% when controlling with remote.

Value.label: ON frame value for single click
Value.Help: This parameter defines value sent to devices in association groups.

Value.label: OFF frame value for single click
Value.Help: This parameter defines value sent to devices in association groups.

Value.label: OFF frame value for double click
Value.Help: This parameter defines value sent to devices in association groups.

Value.label: ON frame value for double click
Value.Help: This parameter defines value sent to devices in association groups.

Value.label: Start programmed sequence
Value.Help: Setting this parameter will start programmed sequence with selected number. User can define own sequences via controller. While the sequence is active, the menu is unavailable.

Item.label: Sequence inactive
Fireplace sequence
Storm sequence
Rainbow sequence
Aurora sequence
Police (red-white-blue) sequence
